metadata.title: CVE-2017-9832 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An integer overflow vulnerability in ptp-pack.c (ptp_unpack_OPL function)of libmtp (version 1.1.12 and below) allows attackers to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds memory access) or maybe remote code execution byinserting a mobile device into a personal computer through a USB cable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9832` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmtp-common - 1.1.13-1
libmtp-runtime - 1.1.13-1
libmtp9 - 1.1.13-1
mtp-tools - 1.1.13-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libmtp package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.13-1').
